ingredients.name: Kale (a large handful of leafy greens of your choice - steamed or braised)

meals.name: Simple Salmon or Halibut
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 400 f. Heat a little oil in a cast iron skillet.
Place fillet in pan, spice side down, and brown 2 minutes.
Turn fillet and bake until it flakes, about 5 minutes. Don�t
overcook.
Alternatively, drizzle with oil and broil on high 5 minutes.
take out and let sit 5 minutes.
OR steam over bed of fresh herbs in a steamer basket for
10 - 15 minutes alongside greens.
Note:
Serve on a bed of dark, leafy greens. Perhaps top with a
yummy cilantro pesto or Parsley Pesto. Make up a few lets
to use for later in the week with other dishes (like you will
with the Simple Roasted Chicken).

meals.name: Kale Soup With Roasted Garlic and Smoked Paprika
meals.instruction:
Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
Add leeks, salt and pepper and cook, stirring often, for 3-5
minutes, until soft.
Add stock, water, potato and paprika.
Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes, until
vegetables are tender.
Remove from heat. Squeeze cloves from garlic into pan.
Blend half of the soup in blender.
Return soup to pan and stir in kale, bring to a simmer over
medium heat until kale is tender.

meals.name: Spring Dump Tea
meals.instruction:
Pour 2 cup of freshly boiled water over herbs in a steeping
tea pot.
Steep 15 minutes with a lid (keeping all the volatile oils in
infusion).
Strain and enjoy. You may add 1/2 tsp honey for flavour.
Enjoy hot or poured over ice with lemon.

meals.name: Simple Bitter Greens Salad
meals.instruction:
Add the mixed greens to a bowl. Add remaining
ingredients and toss to combine. 
It is best to leave greens undressed and add the oil
and vinegar right before eating.

meals.name: Baked Chicken Breast
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Line a baking dish with foil.
Spray or brush both sides of each chicken breast with olive
oil, and sprinkle with the seasonings.
Bake, uncovered, for 10 minutes, flip to the other side,
lightly spray/brush again and bake for 8-10 more minutes,
or until juices run clear when pierced with a fork.
Transfer the baked chicken breasts to a platter. Loosely
cover with foil and allow to rest 5 minutes before slicing and
serving.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Carrot Avocado Rice Bowl
meals.instruction:
Warm oil in a pan over low medium heat. Saute onions and
garlic in pan until softened and fragrant. Add black beans,
cumin and a 1/2 cup of vegetable broth and allow to
simmer for 5 minutes covered and beans are warmed
through and broth is reduced.
Divide rice between 2 bowls. Top rice with a layer of
shredded carrots, beans and avocado. Garnish with parsley
and dress each bowl with a healthy squeeze of lime juice.
Salt and pepper to taste.
Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Extra virgin olive oil (or coconut oil)

meals.name: Kale and Eggs
meals.instruction:
Wash kale in cold water and remove stems.
Whisk the eggs in a bowl with the almond milk.
In pan, warm 2 tbs of oil on medium heat. Toss in the kale;
stir; cover, and let cook for 1-2 minutes.
Uncover and stir kale, pushing it over to side of the pan,
making room for your eggs.
Stir and scramble eggs continuously until cooked. Feel free
to mix the kale into the egg scramble, or keep them
separate. Salt and pepper to your taste.
Serve with your favourite salsa and/or fresh avocado.

ingredients.name: Chicken breast, boneless, skinless (trimmed, cut into 2-inch pieces)

meals.name: Marinated Chicken and Rosemary Kebabs
meals.instruction:
Thread the chicken onto metal skewers and lay in a shallow
dish. Mix the oil, lemon juice, rosemary and pepper together
in a small bowl and pour the marinade over the kebabs.
Cover and refrigerate 2 hours.
Preheat broiler. Arrange kebabs in a baking pan. Broil
kebabs about 10 to 15 minutes or until the chicken is
cooked through, brushing with the marinade during the first
5 minutes, turning frequently.
Serve hot

meals.name: Simple Bitter Greens Salad
meals.instruction:
Add the mixed greens to a bowl. Add remaining
ingredients and toss to combine. 
It is best to leave greens undressed and add the oil
and vinegar right before eating.

ingredients.name: Chicken breast, boneless, skinless (cut into 1-inch cubes)

meals.name: Keto Grilled Pesto Chicken and Tomato Kebabs
meals.instruction:
In a food processor pulse basil, garlic, parmesan
cheese, salt and pepper until smooth. Slowly add the
olive oil while pulsing. Reserve 2-3 tbsp pesto in a
separate bowl.
Combine the raw chicken with the rest of the pesto
and marinate a few hours in a bowl.
Soak wooden skewers in water at least 30 minutes
(or use metal ones to avoid this step).
Beginning and ending with chicken, thread chicken
and tomatoes onto 8 pairs of parallel skewers to
make 8 kebabs total.
Heat the outdoor grill or indoor grill pan over
medium heat until hot. Be sure the grates are clean
and spray lightly with oil.
Place the chicken on the hot grill and cook about 3-4
minutes. Turn and continue cooking until chicken is
cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes. Brush with
the reserved pesto.

ingredients.name: Wild Atlantic salmon, smoked (or chicken or hard-boiled eggs)

meals.name: Salmon Salad with Tahini
meals.instruction:
Add spinach, blueberries, salmon, almonds and sliced
peppers to a bowl.
In a separate lidded container, put lemon juice, tahini, olive
oil, garlic, salt & pepper and water to make the dressing.
Screw on lid and shake until well mixed.
You can also use a blender or food processor to mix
dressing ingredients into a smoother consistency.
Pour dressing over salad just before serving.

meals.name: Lentil, Kale & Sausage Stew
meals.instruction:
Heat oil in large pot over med-high heat. Add sausage and
cook until browned- about 8-10 mins.

Add onions and cook- about 3-5 mins. Add garlic and cook-
about 1 min. Add broth, kale, sweet potatoes, and lentils.

Bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer until lentils and sweet
potatoes are tender- about 30-35 mins.

ingredients.name: Sriracha (to taste/can be omitted to avoid spiciness)

meals.name: Avocado Breakfast Pita
meals.instruction:
Cook the egg in a skillet over medium heat. Season with
salt and pepper. Just before removing from the pan, add
sriracha or your favourite hot sauce.
While the egg is cooking, slice the avocado. Place the
avocado slices inside the pita and smash them over the
surface of one side of the pita with the back of a spoon or a
knife.
Stuff the spinach and egg into the pita as well. Either serve
as is or cook the pita in the skillet on both sides to make it
crispy.

meals.name: Cauliflower Puree
meals.instruction:
1. Using a steaming pot, bring water to a boil over high
heat.
2. While waiting for water to boil, peel and slice carrots -
add to steamer.
3. Cut the cauliflower into florets. Add to steamer.
4. Cut off the ends of brussel sprouts, peeling outer layer
and add to steamer.
5. While waiting for vegetables to cook, add olive oil, garlic
clove and sea salt to blender.
6. When vegetables are cooked, drain water, add all
ingredients to blender
7. Blend on high until you achieve a smooth and creamy
consistency

ingredients.name: Zucchini (leave peel on and squeeze grated zucchini in a kitchen towel to remove excess moisture)
Green onion, scallion, ramp (sliced or 1/2 medium white onion)

meals.name: Chicken Zucchini Meat Balls
meals.instruction: Toss chicken with zucchini, green onion, cilantro, garlic, salt, and pepper and cumin. Mixture will be quite wet. Heat oil in a medium pan over medium heat. Use a small scoop or a heaped tablespoon to scoop meatballs into the pan. Cook 8-10 at a time for about 5-6 minutes on the first side. Flip and cook an additional 4-5 minutes, or until golden brown and the centers are cooked through.

meals.name: Strawberry Mango Spring Smoothie
meals.instruction:
Combine ingredients in blender and blend until smooth.
Yields 3 1/2 cups.

meals.name: Lentil, Kale & Sausage Stew
meals.instruction:
Heat oil in large pot over med-high heat. Add sausage and
cook until browned- about 8-10 mins.

Add onions and cook- about 3-5 mins. Add garlic and cook-
about 1 min. Add broth, kale, sweet potatoes, and lentils.

Bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer until lentils and sweet
potatoes are tender- about 30-35 mins.

meals.name: Lentil, Kale & Sausage Stew
meals.instruction:
Heat oil in large pot over med-high heat. Add sausage and
cook until browned- about 8-10 mins.

Add onions and cook- about 3-5 mins. Add garlic and cook-
about 1 min. Add broth, kale, sweet potatoes, and lentils.

Bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer until lentils and sweet
potatoes are tender- about 30-35 mins.

meals.name: Greek Yogurt with Berries, Nuts and Honey
meals.instruction: Place yogurt in a dish, top with berries, nuts and honey. Option to add granola as a topping!

meals.name: Delicious Detox Smoothie
meals.instruction:
Place all the ingredients into a blender. Blend on high for
1-2 minutes or until all the ingredients are smooth and
blended. Add more water till you get the desired
consistency. Divide into 4 mason jars.
Enjoy!
Mason jar size: 500 mL

meals.name: Delicious Detox Smoothie
meals.instruction:
Place all the ingredients into a blender. Blend on high for
1-2 minutes or until all the ingredients are smooth and
blended. Add more water till you get the desired
consistency. Divide into 4 mason jars.
Enjoy!
Mason jar size: 500 mL

meals.name: Cauliflower Rice
meals.instruction:
Cut cauliflower into large florets.
Rice cauliflower using shredding blade on food processor. Or
pulse cauliflower in food processor with chopping blade, or
grate by hand on box grater.
Heat oil in large frying pan over medium heat. Add
cauliflower rice and saut� until just cooked through, about 5
minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

meals.name: Delicious Detox Smoothie
meals.instruction:
Place all the ingredients into a blender. Blend on high for
1-2 minutes or until all the ingredients are smooth and
blended. Add more water till you get the desired
consistency. Divide into 4 mason jars.
Enjoy!
Mason jar size: 500 mL

meals.name: Spiced Carrot Soup
meals.instruction:
Saut� onion with coconut oil, ginger and turmeric.
Meanwhile, chop carrots into inch thick slices. Add veggie
stock and carrots and bring to a boil. Cover and let simmer
for 5-15 minutes, depending on the thickness of your
carrots. With a fork, test that they are fully cooked through
and remove from heat. Add coconut milk and spices and
blend until smooth.

meals.name: Braised Lentils
meals.instruction:
In medium-sized pot, heat oil over medium heat.
Saute onion, garlic, carrot, celery until softened.
Stir in lentils, salt, paprika, and thyme.
Add vegetables stock and bay leaf. Bring to a boil
and reduce to a simmer.
Simmer for 15 minutes. Remove bay leaf before
serving.

Serve 3/4 cup braised lentils with your choice of rice, barley
or whole wheat couscous and/or a side of vegetables.

meals.name: Green Beans with Walnuts and Onions
meals.instruction:
Cut off green beans ends, boil green beans 3-4 minutes. 
In a large skillet, heat half of the olive oil over medium heat
and cook onions, stirring, for 5 minutes. Add walnuts and
garlic and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
Add the remaining oil and green beans. Season with salt
and pepper, stir and cook for 2 minutes.
Serve as an appetizer or with parboiled rice to make a
complete meal

meals.name: Delicious Detox Smoothie
meals.instruction:
Place all the ingredients into a blender. Blend on high for
1-2 minutes or until all the ingredients are smooth and
blended. Add more water till you get the desired
consistency. Divide into 4 mason jars.
Enjoy!
Mason jar size: 500 mL

meals.name: Cauliflower Rice
meals.instruction:
Cut cauliflower into large florets.
Rice cauliflower using shredding blade on food processor. Or
pulse cauliflower in food processor with chopping blade, or
grate by hand on box grater.
Heat oil in large frying pan over medium heat. Add
cauliflower rice and saut� until just cooked through, about 5
minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

meals.name: Emerald Kale Salad
meals.instruction:
Put chopped kale into a large bowl, drizzle with olive oil and
sprinkle with sea salt.
Massage gently with hands for 5-10 minutes, until the tough
fibers of the kale break down.
Toss with the red onion and cucumber.

ingredients.name: Extra virgin olive oil (or coconut oil)

Pour dressing over salad just before serving.

ingredients.name: Carob chocolate chips (or semisweet chocolate chips)
Rolled oats, dry (or gluten free oats)

meals.name: Almond Butter Energy Balls
meals.instruction:
Mix all the dry ingredients together.
Add the almond butter, honey and vanilla and mix through.
Roll into balls and place on a baking sheet or plate with
parchment paper. If you keep your hands slightly wet it will
help with forming the balls.
Allow to chill in the fridge. Store in an airtight container.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Handful of Almonds
meals.instruction: A handful of roasted almonds makes the perfect snack.

meals.name: Braised Lentils
meals.instruction:
In medium-sized pot, heat oil over medium heat.
Saute onion, garlic, carrot, celery until softened.
Stir in lentils, salt, paprika, and thyme.
Add vegetables stock and bay leaf. Bring to a boil
and reduce to a simmer.
Simmer for 15 minutes. Remove bay leaf before
serving.

Serve 3/4 cup braised lentils with your choice of rice, barley
or whole wheat couscous and/or a side of vegetables.

meals.instruction: A handful of roasted almonds makes the perfect snack.

meals.instruction:

Rice cauliflower using shredding blade on food processor. Or
pulse cauliflower in food processor with chopping blade, or
grate by hand on box grater.
Heat oil in large frying pan over medium heat. Add
cauliflower rice and saut� until just cooked through, about 5

Season with salt and pepper to taste.

ingredients.name: Wild Atlantic salmon, smoked (or chicken or hard-boiled eggs)

meals.name: Salmon Salad with Tahini
meals.instruction:

peppers to a bowl.
In a separate lidded container, put lemon juice, tahini, olive

Screw on lid and shake until well mixed.
You can also use a blender or food processor to mix
dressing ingredients into a smoother consistency.
Pour dressing over salad just before serving.

ingredients.name: Raisins, seedless (sultana) (or cranberries or chopped, dried apples (optional))

meals.name: Banana Nut Pancakes
meals.instruction:
Mix together oats, eggs, banana, coconut milk, vanilla, and
cinnamon.
Add in walnuts and dried fruit of choice.
Heat coconut oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
Scoop 1/2 cup of batter into pan and spread out with a fork
if needed.
Cook until the edges of the pancake start to brown and it
easily lifts off pan.
Flip the pancake over and cook until done.
Repeat with remaining batter and top with your favourite
toppings.
* Gluten-free, dairy-free, sugar-free, vegetarian.

ingredients.name: Tuna, albacore, flaked, canned in water (or mackerel, smoked trout or leftover chicken )
Beets, boiled, drained (or cold, or raw and shredded )
Roasted red peppers, canned (or raw and juiliened )

meals.name: Warm Lentil Salad
meals.instruction:
Warm the lentils slightly. Warm protein, if using something
other than cooked fish. Add a small amount of olive oil to
prevent sticking. Turn off heat.
Toss spinach or arugula into a bowl with parsley. Add the
warm beets ingredients and drizzle with olive oil, lemon
juice and season. Toss until greens are wilted slightly and
warmed through.

ingredients.name: Carob chocolate chips (or semisweet chocolate chips)
Rolled oats, dry (or gluten free oats)

meals.name: Almond Butter Energy Balls
meals.instruction:
Mix all the dry ingredients together.
Add the almond butter, honey and vanilla and mix through.
Roll into balls and place on a baking sheet or plate with
parchment paper. If you keep your hands slightly wet it will
help with forming the balls.
Allow to chill in the fridge. Store in an airtight container.
Enjoy!

Pour dressing over salad just before serving.

meals.name: Roasted Beet Noodles with Pesto and Kale
meals.instruction:
Set the oven to 425 degrees. On a baking sheet, spread out
the beet noodles and coat with cooking spray and season
with salt and pepper.
Bake for 5-10 minutes or until beets are cooked to al dente
or your preference in doneness.
While the noodles cook, combine all of the ingredients for
the pesto into a food processor and pulse until creamy.
Taste and adjust, if needed.
Once beets are cooked, toss with pesto and the kale. Serve.

meals.name: Spring Dump Tea
meals.instruction:
Pour 2 cup of freshly boiled water over herbs in a steeping
tea pot.
Steep 15 minutes with a lid (keeping all the volatile oils in
infusion).
Strain and enjoy. You may add 1/2 tsp honey for flavour.
Enjoy hot or poured over ice with lemon.

ingredients.name: Water, filtered (if needed to thin out consistency)

meals.name: Fall Harvest Salad
meals.instruction:
1. To make the dressing: add all dressing ingredients
(lemon, tahini, salt, cayenne pepper) into a little
bowl and whisk together until one smooth
consistency. Add water bit by bit as needed, if
consistency is too thick.
2. Place kale in a bowl, using 1/2 of the dressing
massage the kale until tender.
3. Top with the rest of the ingredients, remaining salad
dressing and mix well.

meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Line a baking dish with foil.

oil, and sprinkle with the seasonings.
Bake, uncovered, for 10 minutes, flip to the other side,

Simmer for 15 minutes. Remove bay leaf before
serving.

Serve 3/4 cup braised lentils with your choice of rice, barley
or whole wheat couscous and/or a side of vegetables.

ingredients.name: Carob chocolate chips (or semisweet chocolate chips)
Rolled oats, dry (or gluten free oats)

meals.name: Almond Butter Energy Balls
meals.instruction:
Mix all the dry ingredients together.
Add the almond butter, honey and vanilla and mix through.
Roll into balls and place on a baking sheet or plate with
parchment paper. If you keep your hands slightly wet it will
help with forming the balls.
Allow to chill in the fridge. Store in an airtight container.
Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Tuna, albacore, flaked, canned in water (or mackerel, smoked trout or leftover chicken )
Beets, boiled, drained (or cold, or raw and shredded )
Roasted red peppers, canned (or raw and juiliened )

meals.name: Warm Lentil Salad
meals.instruction:
Warm the lentils slightly. Warm protein, if using something
other than cooked fish. Add a small amount of olive oil to
prevent sticking. Turn off heat.
Toss spinach or arugula into a bowl with parsley. Add the
warm beets ingredients and drizzle with olive oil, lemon
juice and season. Toss until greens are wilted slightly and
warmed through.

ingredients.name: Chicken breast, boneless, skinless (cut into 1-inch cubes)

meals.name: Keto Grilled Pesto Chicken and Tomato Kebabs
meals.instruction:
In a food processor pulse basil, garlic, parmesan
cheese, salt and pepper until smooth. Slowly add the
olive oil while pulsing. Reserve 2-3 tbsp pesto in a
separate bowl.
Combine the raw chicken with the rest of the pesto
and marinate a few hours in a bowl.
Soak wooden skewers in water at least 30 minutes
(or use metal ones to avoid this step).
Beginning and ending with chicken, thread chicken
and tomatoes onto 8 pairs of parallel skewers to
make 8 kebabs total.
Heat the outdoor grill or indoor grill pan over
medium heat until hot. Be sure the grates are clean
and spray lightly with oil.
Place the chicken on the hot grill and cook about 3-4
minutes. Turn and continue cooking until chicken is
cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes. Brush with
the reserved pesto.

ingredients.name: Water, filtered (if needed to thin out consistency)

meals.name: Fall Harvest Salad
meals.instruction:
1. To make the dressing: add all dressing ingredients
(lemon, tahini, salt, cayenne pepper) into a little
bowl and whisk together until one smooth
consistency. Add water bit by bit as needed, if
consistency is too thick.
2. Place kale in a bowl, using 1/2 of the dressing
massage the kale until tender.
3. Top with the rest of the ingredients, remaining salad
dressing and mix well.

meals.name: Handful of Almonds
meals.instruction: A handful of roasted almonds makes the perfect snack.

meals.name: Emerald Kale Salad
meals.instruction:
Put chopped kale into a large bowl, drizzle with olive oil and
sprinkle with sea salt.
Massage gently with hands for 5-10 minutes, until the tough
fibers of the kale break down.
Toss with the red onion and cucumber.

meals.name: Cauliflower Puree
meals.instruction:
1. Using a steaming pot, bring water to a boil over high
heat.
2. While waiting for water to boil, peel and slice carrots -
add to steamer.
3. Cut the cauliflower into florets. Add to steamer.
4. Cut off the ends of brussel sprouts, peeling outer layer
and add to steamer.
5. While waiting for vegetables to cook, add olive oil, garlic
clove and sea salt to blender.
6. When vegetables are cooked, drain water, add all
ingredients to blender
7. Blend on high until you achieve a smooth and creamy
consistency

ingredients.name: Chicken breast, boneless, skinless (cut into 1-inch cubes)

meals.name: Keto Grilled Pesto Chicken and Tomato Kebabs
meals.instruction:
In a food processor pulse basil, garlic, parmesan
cheese, salt and pepper until smooth. Slowly add the
olive oil while pulsing. Reserve 2-3 tbsp pesto in a
separate bowl.
Combine the raw chicken with the rest of the pesto
and marinate a few hours in a bowl.
Soak wooden skewers in water at least 30 minutes
(or use metal ones to avoid this step).
Beginning and ending with chicken, thread chicken
and tomatoes onto 8 pairs of parallel skewers to
make 8 kebabs total.
Heat the outdoor grill or indoor grill pan over
medium heat until hot. Be sure the grates are clean
and spray lightly with oil.
Place the chicken on the hot grill and cook about 3-4
minutes. Turn and continue cooking until chicken is
cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes. Brush with
the reserved pesto.

meals.name: Greek Yogurt with Berries, Nuts and Honey
meals.instruction: Place yogurt in a dish, top with berries, nuts and honey. Option to add granola as a topping!

meals.name: Spiced Carrot Soup
meals.instruction:
Saut� onion with coconut oil, ginger and turmeric.
Meanwhile, chop carrots into inch thick slices. Add veggie
stock and carrots and bring to a boil. Cover and let simmer
for 5-15 minutes, depending on the thickness of your
carrots. With a fork, test that they are fully cooked through
and remove from heat. Add coconut milk and spices and
blend until smooth.

ingredients.name: Chicken breast, boneless, skinless (trimmed, cut into 2-inch pieces)

meals.name: Marinated Chicken and Rosemary Kebabs
meals.instruction:
Thread the chicken onto metal skewers and lay in a shallow
dish. Mix the oil, lemon juice, rosemary and pepper together
in a small bowl and pour the marinade over the kebabs.
Cover and refrigerate 2 hours.
Preheat broiler. Arrange kebabs in a baking pan. Broil
kebabs about 10 to 15 minutes or until the chicken is
cooked through, brushing with the marinade during the first
5 minutes, turning frequently.
Serve hot

meals.name: Cauliflower Rice
meals.instruction:
Cut cauliflower into large florets.
Rice cauliflower using shredding blade on food processor. Or
pulse cauliflower in food processor with chopping blade, or
grate by hand on box grater.
Heat oil in large frying pan over medium heat. Add
cauliflower rice and saut� until just cooked through, about 5
minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

meals.name: Roasted Beet Noodles with Pesto and Kale
meals.instruction:
Set the oven to 425 degrees. On a baking sheet, spread out
the beet noodles and coat with cooking spray and season
with salt and pepper.
Bake for 5-10 minutes or until beets are cooked to al dente
or your preference in doneness.
While the noodles cook, combine all of the ingredients for
the pesto into a food processor and pulse until creamy.
Taste and adjust, if needed.
Once beets are cooked, toss with pesto and the kale. Serve.

meals.name: Baked Chicken Breast
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Line a baking dish with foil.
Spray or brush both sides of each chicken breast with olive
oil, and sprinkle with the seasonings.
Bake, uncovered, for 10 minutes, flip to the other side,
lightly spray/brush again and bake for 8-10 more minutes,
or until juices run clear when pierced with a fork.
Transfer the baked chicken breasts to a platter. Loosely
cover with foil and allow to rest 5 minutes before slicing and
serving.
Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Chicken breast, boneless, skinless (trimmed, cut into 2-inch pieces)

meals.name: Marinated Chicken and Rosemary Kebabs
meals.instruction:
Thread the chicken onto metal skewers and lay in a shallow
dish. Mix the oil, lemon juice, rosemary and pepper together
in a small bowl and pour the marinade over the kebabs.
Cover and refrigerate 2 hours.
Preheat broiler. Arrange kebabs in a baking pan. Broil
kebabs about 10 to 15 minutes or until the chicken is
cooked through, brushing with the marinade during the first
5 minutes, turning frequently.
Serve hot

meals.name: Simple Bitter Greens Salad
meals.instruction:
Add the mixed greens to a bowl. Add remaining
ingredients and toss to combine. 
It is best to leave greens undressed and add the oil
and vinegar right before eating.

ingredients.name: Zucchini (leave peel on and squeeze grated zucchini in a kitchen towel to remove excess moisture)
Green onion, scallion, ramp (sliced or 1/2 medium white onion)

meals.name: Chicken Zucchini Meat Balls
meals.instruction: Toss chicken with zucchini, green onion, cilantro, garlic, salt, and pepper and cumin. Mixture will be quite wet. Heat oil in a medium pan over medium heat. Use a small scoop or a heaped tablespoon to scoop meatballs into the pan. Cook 8-10 at a time for about 5-6 minutes on the first side. Flip and cook an additional 4-5 minutes, or until golden brown and the centers are cooked through.

meals.name: Spring Dump Tea
meals.instruction:
Pour 2 cup of freshly boiled water over herbs in a steeping
tea pot.
Steep 15 minutes with a lid (keeping all the volatile oils in
infusion).
Strain and enjoy. You may add 1/2 tsp honey for flavour.
Enjoy hot or poured over ice with lemon.

meals.name: Cauliflower Puree
meals.instruction:
1. Using a steaming pot, bring water to a boil over high
heat.
2. While waiting for water to boil, peel and slice carrots -
add to steamer.
3. Cut the cauliflower into florets. Add to steamer.
4. Cut off the ends of brussel sprouts, peeling outer layer
and add to steamer.
5. While waiting for vegetables to cook, add olive oil, garlic
clove and sea salt to blender.
6. When vegetables are cooked, drain water, add all
ingredients to blender
7. Blend on high until you achieve a smooth and creamy
consistency

meals.name: Carrot Avocado Rice Bowl
meals.instruction:
Warm oil in a pan over low medium heat. Saute onions and
garlic in pan until softened and fragrant. Add black beans,
cumin and a 1/2 cup of vegetable broth and allow to
simmer for 5 minutes covered and beans are warmed
through and broth is reduced.
Divide rice between 2 bowls. Top rice with a layer of
shredded carrots, beans and avocado. Garnish with parsley
and dress each bowl with a healthy squeeze of lime juice.
Salt and pepper to taste.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Spiced Carrot Soup
meals.instruction:
Saut� onion with coconut oil, ginger and turmeric.
Meanwhile, chop carrots into inch thick slices. Add veggie
stock and carrots and bring to a boil. Cover and let simmer
for 5-15 minutes, depending on the thickness of your
carrots. With a fork, test that they are fully cooked through
and remove from heat. Add coconut milk and spices and
blend until smooth.

meals.name: Green Beans with Walnuts and Onions
meals.instruction:
Cut off green beans ends, boil green beans 3-4 minutes. 
In a large skillet, heat half of the olive oil over medium heat
and cook onions, stirring, for 5 minutes. Add walnuts and
garlic and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
Add the remaining oil and green beans. Season with salt
and pepper, stir and cook for 2 minutes.
Serve as an appetizer or with parboiled rice to make a
complete meal

meals.name: Strawberry Mango Spring Smoothie
meals.instruction:
Combine ingredients in blender and blend until smooth.
Yields 3 1/2 cups.

ingredients.name: Extra virgin olive oil (or coconut oil)

meals.name: Kale and Eggs
meals.instruction:
Wash kale in cold water and remove stems.
Whisk the eggs in a bowl with the almond milk.
In pan, warm 2 tbs of oil on medium heat. Toss in the kale;
stir; cover, and let cook for 1-2 minutes.
Uncover and stir kale, pushing it over to side of the pan,
making room for your eggs.
Stir and scramble eggs continuously until cooked. Feel free
to mix the kale into the egg scramble, or keep them
separate. Salt and pepper to your taste.
Serve with your favourite salsa and/or fresh avocado.

meals.name: Baked Chicken Breast
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Line a baking dish with foil.
Spray or brush both sides of each chicken breast with olive
oil, and sprinkle with the seasonings.
Bake, uncovered, for 10 minutes, flip to the other side,
lightly spray/brush again and bake for 8-10 more minutes,
or until juices run clear when pierced with a fork.
Transfer the baked chicken breasts to a platter. Loosely
cover with foil and allow to rest 5 minutes before slicing and
serving.
Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Zucchini (leave peel on and squeeze grated zucchini in a kitchen towel to remove excess moisture)
Green onion, scallion, ramp (sliced or 1/2 medium white onion)

meals.instruction: Toss chicken with zucchini, green onion, cilantro, garlic, salt, and pepper and cumin. Mixture will be quite wet. Heat oil in a medium pan over medium heat. Use a small scoop or a heaped tablespoon to scoop meatballs into the pan. Cook 8-10 at a time for about 5-6 minutes on the first side. Flip and cook an additional 4-5 minutes, or until golden brown and the centers are cooked through.

meals.name: Roasted Beet Noodles with Pesto and Kale
meals.instruction:
Set the oven to 425 degrees. On a baking sheet, spread out

While the noodles cook, combine all of the ingredients for

Once beets are cooked, toss with pesto and the kale. Serve.

meals.name: Strawberry Mango Spring Smoothie
meals.instruction:
Combine ingredients in blender and blend until smooth.
Yields 3 1/2 cups.

ingredients.name: Raisins, seedless (sultana) (or cranberries or chopped, dried apples (optional))

meals.name: Banana Nut Pancakes
meals.instruction:
Mix together oats, eggs, banana, coconut milk, vanilla, and
cinnamon.
Add in walnuts and dried fruit of choice.
Heat coconut oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
Scoop 1/2 cup of batter into pan and spread out with a fork
if needed.
Cook until the edges of the pancake start to brown and it
easily lifts off pan.
Flip the pancake over and cook until done.
Repeat with remaining batter and top with your favourite
toppings.
* Gluten-free, dairy-free, sugar-free, vegetarian.

meals.name: Simple Bitter Greens Salad
meals.instruction:
Add the mixed greens to a bowl. Add remaining
ingredients and toss to combine. 
It is best to leave greens undressed and add the oil
and vinegar right before eating.

meals.name: Strawberry Mango Spring Smoothie
meals.instruction:
Combine ingredients in blender and blend until smooth.
Yields 3 1/2 cups.

meals.name: Greek Yogurt with Berries, Nuts and Honey
meals.instruction: Place yogurt in a dish, top with berries, nuts and honey. Option to add granola as a topping!

meals.name: Spring Dump Tea
meals.instruction:
Pour 2 cup of freshly boiled water over herbs in a steeping
tea pot.
Steep 15 minutes with a lid (keeping all the volatile oils in
infusion).
Strain and enjoy. You may add 1/2 tsp honey for flavour.
Enjoy hot or poured over ice with lemon.

meals.name: Cauliflower Rice
meals.instruction:
Cut cauliflower into large florets.
Rice cauliflower using shredding blade on food processor. Or
pulse cauliflower in food processor with chopping blade, or
grate by hand on box grater.
Heat oil in large frying pan over medium heat. Add
cauliflower rice and saut� until just cooked through, about 5
minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

meals.name: Emerald Kale Salad
meals.instruction:
Put chopped kale into a large bowl, drizzle with olive oil and
sprinkle with sea salt.
Massage gently with hands for 5-10 minutes, until the tough
fibers of the kale break down.
Toss with the red onion and cucumber.

ingredients.name: Kale (a large handful of leafy greens of your choice - steamed or braised)

meals.name: Simple Salmon or Halibut
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 400 f. Heat a little oil in a cast iron skillet.
Place fillet in pan, spice side down, and brown 2 minutes.
Turn fillet and bake until it flakes, about 5 minutes. Don�t
overcook.
Alternatively, drizzle with oil and broil on high 5 minutes.
take out and let sit 5 minutes.
OR steam over bed of fresh herbs in a steamer basket for
10 - 15 minutes alongside greens.
Note:
Serve on a bed of dark, leafy greens. Perhaps top with a
yummy cilantro pesto or Parsley Pesto. Make up a few lets
to use for later in the week with other dishes (like you will
with the Simple Roasted Chicken).

ingredients.name: Kale (a large handful of leafy greens of your choice - steamed or braised)

meals.name: Simple Salmon or Halibut
meals.instruction:

Place fillet in pan, spice side down, and brown 2 minutes.
Turn fillet and bake until it flakes, about 5 minutes. Don�t

ingredients.name: Wild Atlantic salmon, smoked (or chicken or hard-boiled eggs)

meals.name: Salmon Salad with Tahini
meals.instruction:
Add spinach, blueberries, salmon, almonds and sliced
peppers to a bowl.
In a separate lidded container, put lemon juice, tahini, olive
oil, garlic, salt & pepper and water to make the dressing.
Screw on lid and shake until well mixed.
You can also use a blender or food processor to mix
dressing ingredients into a smoother consistency.
Pour dressing over salad just before serving.

ingredients.name: Raisins, seedless (sultana) (or cranberries or chopped, dried apples (optional))

meals.name: Banana Nut Pancakes
meals.instruction:
Mix together oats, eggs, banana, coconut milk, vanilla, and
cinnamon.
Add in walnuts and dried fruit of choice.
Heat coconut oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
Scoop 1/2 cup of batter into pan and spread out with a fork

Flip the pancake over and cook until done.
Repeat with remaining batter and top with your favourite
toppings.
* Gluten-free, dairy-free, sugar-free, vegetarian.

meals.instruction:
Add the mixed greens to a bowl. Add remaining
ingredients and toss to combine. 
It is best to leave greens undressed and add the oil
and vinegar right before eating.

sprinkle with sea salt.

fibers of the kale break down.
Toss with the red onion and cucumber.

meals.instruction:

ingredients.name: Water, filtered (if needed to thin out consistency)

meals.name: Fall Harvest Salad
meals.instruction:
1. To make the dressing: add all dressing ingredients

bowl and whisk together until one smooth
consistency. Add water bit by bit as needed, if

2. Place kale in a bowl, using 1/2 of the dressing

3. Top with the rest of the ingredients, remaining salad

meals.name: Kale Soup With Roasted Garlic and Smoked Paprika
meals.instruction:
Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
Add leeks, salt and pepper and cook, stirring often, for 3-5
minutes, until soft.
Add stock, water, potato and paprika.
Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes, until
vegetables are tender.
Remove from heat. Squeeze cloves from garlic into pan.
Blend half of the soup in blender.
Return soup to pan and stir in kale, bring to a simmer over
medium heat until kale is tender.

meals.name: Cauliflower Rice
meals.instruction:
Cut cauliflower into large florets.
Rice cauliflower using shredding blade on food processor. Or
pulse cauliflower in food processor with chopping blade, or
grate by hand on box grater.
Heat oil in large frying pan over medium heat. Add
cauliflower rice and saut� until just cooked through, about 5
minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

meals.name: Green Beans with Walnuts and Onions
meals.instruction:
Cut off green beans ends, boil green beans 3-4 minutes. 
In a large skillet, heat half of the olive oil over medium heat
and cook onions, stirring, for 5 minutes. Add walnuts and
garlic and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
Add the remaining oil and green beans. Season with salt
and pepper, stir and cook for 2 minutes.
Serve as an appetizer or with parboiled rice to make a
complete meal

ingredients.name: Sriracha (to taste/can be omitted to avoid spiciness)

meals.name: Avocado Breakfast Pita
meals.instruction:
Cook the egg in a skillet over medium heat. Season with
salt and pepper. Just before removing from the pan, add
sriracha or your favourite hot sauce.
While the egg is cooking, slice the avocado. Place the
avocado slices inside the pita and smash them over the
surface of one side of the pita with the back of a spoon or a
knife.
Stuff the spinach and egg into the pita as well. Either serve
as is or cook the pita in the skillet on both sides to make it
crispy.

meals.name: Cauliflower Rice
meals.instruction:
Cut cauliflower into large florets.
Rice cauliflower using shredding blade on food processor. Or
pulse cauliflower in food processor with chopping blade, or
grate by hand on box grater.
Heat oil in large frying pan over medium heat. Add
cauliflower rice and saut� until just cooked through, about 5
minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Mix together oats, eggs, banana, coconut milk, vanilla, and
cinnamon.
Add in walnuts and dried fruit of choice.
Heat coconut oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
Scoop 1/2 cup of batter into pan and spread out with a fork
if needed.
Cook until the edges of the pancake start to brown and it
easily lifts off pan.
Flip the pancake over and cook until done.
Repeat with remaining batter and top with your favourite
toppings.
* Gluten-free, dairy-free, sugar-free, vegetarian.

meals.name: Cauliflower Rice
meals.instruction:
Cut cauliflower into large florets.
Rice cauliflower using shredding blade on food processor. Or
pulse cauliflower in food processor with chopping blade, or
grate by hand on box grater.
Heat oil in large frying pan over medium heat. Add
cauliflower rice and saut� until just cooked through, about 5
minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

ingredients.name: Tuna, albacore, flaked, canned in water (or mackerel, smoked trout or leftover chicken )
Beets, boiled, drained (or cold, or raw and shredded )
Roasted red peppers, canned (or raw and juiliened )

meals.name: Warm Lentil Salad
meals.instruction:
Warm the lentils slightly. Warm protein, if using something
other than cooked fish. Add a small amount of olive oil to
prevent sticking. Turn off heat.
Toss spinach or arugula into a bowl with parsley. Add the
warm beets ingredients and drizzle with olive oil, lemon
juice and season. Toss until greens are wilted slightly and
warmed through.

ingredients.name: Tuna, albacore, flaked, canned in water (or mackerel, smoked trout or leftover chicken )
Beets, boiled, drained (or cold, or raw and shredded )
Roasted red peppers, canned (or raw and juiliened )

meals.name: Warm Lentil Salad
meals.instruction:
Warm the lentils slightly. Warm protein, if using something
other than cooked fish. Add a small amount of olive oil to
prevent sticking. Turn off heat.
Toss spinach or arugula into a bowl with parsley. Add the
warm beets ingredients and drizzle with olive oil, lemon
juice and season. Toss until greens are wilted slightly and
warmed through.

ingredients.name: Zucchini (leave peel on and squeeze grated zucchini in a kitchen towel to remove excess moisture)
Green onion, scallion, ramp (sliced or 1/2 medium white onion)

meals.name: Chicken Zucchini Meat Balls
meals.instruction: Toss chicken with zucchini, green onion, cilantro, garlic, salt, and pepper and cumin. Mixture will be quite wet. Heat oil in a medium pan over medium heat. Use a small scoop or a heaped tablespoon to scoop meatballs into the pan. Cook 8-10 at a time for about 5-6 minutes on the first side. Flip and cook an additional 4-5 minutes, or until golden brown and the centers are cooked through.

meals.name: Handful of Almonds
meals.instruction: A handful of roasted almonds makes the perfect snack.

meals.name: Cauliflower Puree
meals.instruction:
1. Using a steaming pot, bring water to a boil over high
heat.
2. While waiting for water to boil, peel and slice carrots -
add to steamer.
3. Cut the cauliflower into florets. Add to steamer.
4. Cut off the ends of brussel sprouts, peeling outer layer
and add to steamer.
5. While waiting for vegetables to cook, add olive oil, garlic
clove and sea salt to blender.
6. When vegetables are cooked, drain water, add all
ingredients to blender
7. Blend on high until you achieve a smooth and creamy
consistency

ingredients.name: Sriracha (to taste/can be omitted to avoid spiciness)

meals.name: Avocado Breakfast Pita
meals.instruction:
Cook the egg in a skillet over medium heat. Season with
salt and pepper. Just before removing from the pan, add
sriracha or your favourite hot sauce.
While the egg is cooking, slice the avocado. Place the
avocado slices inside the pita and smash them over the
surface of one side of the pita with the back of a spoon or a
knife.
Stuff the spinach and egg into the pita as well. Either serve
as is or cook the pita in the skillet on both sides to make it
crispy.

ingredients.name: Chicken breast, boneless, skinless (cut into 1-inch cubes)

meals.name: Keto Grilled Pesto Chicken and Tomato Kebabs
meals.instruction:
In a food processor pulse basil, garlic, parmesan
cheese, salt and pepper until smooth. Slowly add the
olive oil while pulsing. Reserve 2-3 tbsp pesto in a
separate bowl.
Combine the raw chicken with the rest of the pesto
and marinate a few hours in a bowl.
Soak wooden skewers in water at least 30 minutes
(or use metal ones to avoid this step).
Beginning and ending with chicken, thread chicken
and tomatoes onto 8 pairs of parallel skewers to
make 8 kebabs total.
Heat the outdoor grill or indoor grill pan over
medium heat until hot. Be sure the grates are clean
and spray lightly with oil.
Place the chicken on the hot grill and cook about 3-4
minutes. Turn and continue cooking until chicken is
cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes. Brush with
the reserved pesto.

meals.name: Carrot Avocado Rice Bowl
meals.instruction:
Warm oil in a pan over low medium heat. Saute onions and
garlic in pan until softened and fragrant. Add black beans,
cumin and a 1/2 cup of vegetable broth and allow to
simmer for 5 minutes covered and beans are warmed
through and broth is reduced.
Divide rice between 2 bowls. Top rice with a layer of
shredded carrots, beans and avocado. Garnish with parsley
and dress each bowl with a healthy squeeze of lime juice.
Salt and pepper to taste.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Handful of Almonds
meals.instruction: A handful of roasted almonds makes the perfect snack.

meals.name: Cauliflower Rice
meals.instruction:
Cut cauliflower into large florets.
Rice cauliflower using shredding blade on food processor. Or
pulse cauliflower in food processor with chopping blade, or
grate by hand on box grater.
Heat oil in large frying pan over medium heat. Add
cauliflower rice and saut� until just cooked through, about 5
minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

meals.name: Cauliflower Rice
meals.instruction:
Cut cauliflower into large florets.
Rice cauliflower using shredding blade on food processor. Or
pulse cauliflower in food processor with chopping blade, or
grate by hand on box grater.
Heat oil in large frying pan over medium heat. Add
cauliflower rice and saut� until just cooked through, about 5
minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

meals.name: Strawberry Mango Spring Smoothie
meals.instruction:
Combine ingredients in blender and blend until smooth.
Yields 3 1/2 cups.

ingredients.name: Kale (a large handful of leafy greens of your choice - steamed or braised)

meals.name: Simple Salmon or Halibut
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 400 f. Heat a little oil in a cast iron skillet.
Place fillet in pan, spice side down, and brown 2 minutes.
Turn fillet and bake until it flakes, about 5 minutes. Don�t
overcook.
Alternatively, drizzle with oil and broil on high 5 minutes.
take out and let sit 5 minutes.
OR steam over bed of fresh herbs in a steamer basket for
10 - 15 minutes alongside greens.
Note:
Serve on a bed of dark, leafy greens. Perhaps top with a
yummy cilantro pesto or Parsley Pesto. Make up a few lets
to use for later in the week with other dishes (like you will
with the Simple Roasted Chicken).

ingredients.name: Carob chocolate chips (or semisweet chocolate chips)
Rolled oats, dry (or gluten free oats)

meals.name: Almond Butter Energy Balls
meals.instruction:
Mix all the dry ingredients together.
Add the almond butter, honey and vanilla and mix through.
Roll into balls and place on a baking sheet or plate with
parchment paper. If you keep your hands slightly wet it will
help with forming the balls.
Allow to chill in the fridge. Store in an airtight container.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Greek Yogurt with Berries, Nuts and Honey
meals.instruction: Place yogurt in a dish, top with berries, nuts and honey. Option to add granola as a topping!

ingredients.name: Water, filtered (if needed to thin out consistency)

meals.name: Fall Harvest Salad
meals.instruction:
1. To make the dressing: add all dressing ingredients
(lemon, tahini, salt, cayenne pepper) into a little
bowl and whisk together until one smooth
consistency. Add water bit by bit as needed, if
consistency is too thick.
2. Place kale in a bowl, using 1/2 of the dressing
massage the kale until tender.
3. Top with the rest of the ingredients, remaining salad
dressing and mix well.

meals.name: Handful of Almonds
meals.instruction: A handful of roasted almonds makes the perfect snack.

ingredients.name: Extra virgin olive oil (or coconut oil)

meals.name: Kale and Eggs
meals.instruction:
Wash kale in cold water and remove stems.
Whisk the eggs in a bowl with the almond milk.
In pan, warm 2 tbs of oil on medium heat. Toss in the kale;
stir; cover, and let cook for 1-2 minutes.
Uncover and stir kale, pushing it over to side of the pan,
making room for your eggs.
Stir and scramble eggs continuously until cooked. Feel free
to mix the kale into the egg scramble, or keep them
separate. Salt and pepper to your taste.
Serve with your favourite salsa and/or fresh avocado.
